pullRequest.title: Manager bsc1132576
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
Fix detection of SLES ES6 systems in the bootstrap script. This is quite hacky, as such systems contain an additional file /etc/centos-release with unexpected contents ("Red Hat" instead of "CentOS") which breaks the initial logic.
This PR implicitly reverts
https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/commit/2889cdfa57dd0d2a79a9a4db4ee36d3750ca9bc9
as this one will not work correctly on genuine CentOS systems.
If somebody comes up with a better idea to correctly detect such a system, I would love to hear. But then we probably would need to parse the release files in more depths than just checking for the base OS.
GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

commit.message: fix detection of SLES ES6 systems (bsc#1132576)
fix detection of SLES ES6 systems (bsc#1132576)

nodes.bodyText: Does SLES ES7 has this file as well?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -358,12 +358,22 @@ def getRegistrationStackSh(saltEnabled):
     function getY_CLIENT_CODE_BASE() {{
         local BASE=""
         local VERSION=""
-        if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ]; then
-            grep -v '^#' /etc/redhat-release | grep -q '\(Red Hat\)' && BASE="res"
-            VERSION=`grep -v '^#' /etc/redhat-release | grep -Po '(?<=release )\d+'`
+        # SLES ES6 is a special case; it will install a symlink named
+        # centos-release pointing to redhat-release which will make the
+        # original test fail; reverting the checks does not help as this
+        # will break genuine CentOS systems. So use the poor man's approach
+        # to detect this special case. SLES ES7 does not have this issue
+        # https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1132576
+        # https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1152795
+        if [ -L /usr/share/doc/sles_es-release ]; then
